result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew M Toshner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count #2, the Court sentences the Mr. Tosher to pay a fine of $500 + 61.51 for subpoena fees + costs = $1144.50 to be paid in $150 per month installments commencing on 2/28/17 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 24 day jail term consecutive.
The Court requires the Mr. Toshner to submit DNA sample on demand.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew M Toshner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission
with Elements and CCS

[JK] case called at 9:32am. 
Defendant Matthew M Toshner in court with Attorney Daniel Fay.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " no contest " entered on Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Mr. Toshner guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
DA Happ submits Victim Impact Statement to the Court.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1.

On Count #2, the Court sentences the Mr. Tosher to pay a fine of $500 + 61.51 for subpoena fees + costs = $1144.50 to be paid in $150 per month installments commencing on 2/28/17 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 24 day jail term consecutive.
The Court requires the Mr. Toshner to submit DNA sample on demand.
recess 9:45am

Case called at 9:36am [mo]
Defendant Matthew M Toshner in court with attorney Daniel P Fay.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Fay indicates that this case will be proceeding to trial
DA Happ indicates that all witnesses have been subpoenaed

The Court informs Mr. Toshner that today is his last opportunity to enter a plea

The Court and Counsel discuss trial procedures:
--Witnesses: State (4)/Defense(0)
--One Day
--Jurors will be able to take notes and ask questions



On State's Motion to Admit Statements of Defendant:
--no need for Miranda/Goodchild hearing
--the Court grants motion

On State's Motion to Admit Defendant's Priors:
--arguments given by DA Happ
--argument given by Atty. Fay
--If Mr. Toshner decides to testify, he has 3 prior convictions for purposes of trial.
